title: 1001-H
statement: H. Oracle for f(x) = parity of the number of 1s in xtime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputImplement a quantum oracle onNqubits which implements the following function:, i.e., the value of the function is 1 ifxhas odd number of 1s, and 0 otherwise.InputYou have to implement an operation which takes the following inputs:an array of qubitsx(input register),a qubity(output qubit).The operation doesn't have an output; the "output" of your solution is the state in which it left the qubits.Your code should have the following signature:namespace Solution {open Microsoft.Quantum.Primitive;open Microsoft.Quantum.Canon;operation Solve (x : Qubit[], y : Qubit) : (){body{// your code here}}}

processed.result:
You are given a set of qubits ($x$) and need to create a quantum operation that determines if the number of 1s in the input qubits ($x$) is odd or even. 

The operation takes the following:

*  An array of qubits ($x$) as input.
*  A single qubit ($y$) as input.

The operation does not produce any output. Instead, it modifies the state of the qubits.

The goal is to design an operation that leaves qubit $y$ in a state of:

*  |1⟩ if the number of 1s in $x$ is odd.
*  |0⟩ if the number of 1s in $x$ is even. 

You should write your code in the provided format.
Create a program that takes a set of bits and a single extra bit. The program should change the state of the extra bit depending on whether the set of bits has an odd or even number of "1"s.
